intro: Hypocylix kerneri var. syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian hypocylix, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the mountainous regions of Syria. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in cool, shaded environments with well-drained soil, often found in rocky or limestone substrates. Its foliage is typically a deep green, and it has a compact growth habit. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
